page.title: 09How Our Grandfathers Lived.
page.content: Primary Schools in secluded glens fed into Towie Junior Secondary which had on average 140 pupils.Now it is a two teacher primary with 30 on its role, most other schools having closed in the area.The 3R's were soundly taught to children wearing short trousers / skirts & tackety boots or barefoot in summer.Discipline was strict and regimental,a sharp contrast to today's modern methods of teaching. In living memory,8-12 crofts have been replaced by 1 large unit,denuding the glens of families.The older generation remember a working day from 5.30am to 6pm and often at 9pm,the Clydesdale horses were fed & groomed before tractors & new machinery replaced this from the 1930's onwards. Roads were not surfaced until the 1920's, hence were rutted & dusty.
